intro: Jatus hamiltonianus, commonly known as the Hamilton's jatus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
